intro_text: Your patrol finds a loner who is interested in joining the Flock. They banter with the birtac a bit, making them feel more welcome.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to leave the loner be.

success_text.unscathed_common: The patrol doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Flock.
success_text.unscathed_rare: The patrol doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Flock with their clutch of chicks.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The loner has a pleasant chat with the patrol, but ultimately they decide not to join.

antagonize_text: Your patrol approaches the loner and tells them firmly that newcomers aren't being taken in right now. The loner seems disappointed, but leaves anyway.
antagonize_fail_text: The patrol approaches the loner and tries to explain that c_n currently has enough mouths to feed, but the loner seems to take offense and leaves in a huff.

intro_text: p_l finds a loner who is interested in joining the Flock. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/banter/banters} with the loner a bit, making them feel more welcome.
decline_text: p_l decides to leave the loner be.

success_text.unscathed_common: p_l doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Flock.

antagonize_fail_text: p_l approaches the loner and tries to explain that c_n currently has enough mouths to feed, but the loner seems to take offense and leaves in a huff.

intro_text: Your patrol finds a loner who is interested in joining the Flock. They banter with the loner for a bit, finding out that they know elkeir.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to leave the loner be.

success_text.unscathed_common: The patrol doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Flock.
success_text.unscathed_rare: The patrol doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Flock with their clutch of chicks.

fail_text.unscathed_common: Though they decline politely, the descriptions of Flock life seem to have frightened the loner.

antagonize_text: Your patrol approaches the loner and tells them firmly that newcomers aren't being taken in right now. The loner seems disappointed, but leaves anyway.
antagonize_fail_text: The patrol approaches the loner and tries to explain that c_n currently has enough mouths to feed, but the loner seems to take offense and leaves in a huff.

intro_text: p_l finds a loner who is interested in joining the Flock. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/banter/banters} with the loner a bit, finding out that they know elkeir.
decline_text: p_l decides to leave the loner be.

success_text.unscathed_common: p_l doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Flock.
success_text.unscathed_rare: p_l doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Flock with their clutch of chicks.

fail_text.unscathed_common: Though they decline politely, the descriptions of Flock life seem to have frightened the loner.

antagonize_text: p_l approaches the loner and tells them firmly that newcomers aren't being taken in right now. The loner seems disappointed, but leaves anyway.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l approaches the loner and tries to explain that c_n currently has enough mouths to feed, but the loner seems to take offense and leaves in a huff.

intro_text: r_c finds a wounded birtac near the Thunderpath.
decline_text: They leave the wounded birtac alone.

success_text.unscathed_common: The patrol approaches the injured birtac and sees signs of life. Alarmed, they gently pick up the birtac and take them back to camp to be treated. The grateful birtac decides to join the Flock.

fail_text.unscathed_common: As r_c inspects the birtac, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} that they are already hunting with their ancestors. The patrol takes a moment to say a prayer for the birtac and bury them.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: The cats attempt to carry the birtac back to camp, but the birtac passes on the way. They stop to bury the birtac before continuing home.

antagonize_text: Your patrol helps the birtac to the nearest healer. They can't spare the herbs for an outsider right now.
antagonize_fail_text: The patrol attempts to help the birtac to a healer nearby, but the birtac passes before they can make it. They bury the birtac outside their borders.

intro_text: p_l finds a wounded one near the Thunderpath.
decline_text: p_l leaves the wounded one alone.

success_text.unscathed_common: p_l approaches the injured birtac and sees signs of life. Alarmed, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} gently {VERB/p_l/pick/picks} up the birtac and {VERB/p_l/take/takes} them back to camp to be treated. The grateful birtac decides to join the Flock.

fail_text.unscathed_common: As p_l inspects the birtac, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/find/finds} that they are already hunting with their ancestors. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/take/takes} a moment to say a prayer for the birtac and bury them.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: p_l attempts to carry the one back to camp, but the one passes on the way. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/stop/stops} to bury the one before continuing home.

antagonize_text: p_l helps the birtac to the nearest healer. c_n can't spare the herbs for an outsider right now.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l attempts to help the birtac to a healer nearby, but the birtac passes before the two can make it back. p_l buries the birtac outside c_n borders.

intro_text: r_c finds an abandoned chick whose parents are nowhere to be found.
decline_text: The patrol goes to approach when the missing parent appears, raising their talons in defense of their baby. Nevermind!

success_text.unscathed_common: r_c rushes the chick back to camp. The chick is nursed back to health and promised a place in the Flock.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The chick is rushed back to camp, but grows weak and dies a few days later.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: The patrol approaches the chick, only to realize that it's already gone. They say a small prayer and bury it.

antagonize_text: Your patrol can't bear to leave the chick alone, so they take it to the border of the closest Flock and wait for a patrol to arrive. The other Flock agrees to take the chick.
antagonize_fail_text: Your patrol attempts to take the kit to a neighboring Flock instead of leaving it, but it dies on the journey. They give it a small burial.

intro_text: p_l finds an abandoned chick whose parents are nowhere to be found.
decline_text: p_l goes to approach when the missing parent appears, raising their talons in defense of their baby. Nevermind!

success_text.unscathed_common: p_l rushes the chick back to camp. The chick is nursed back to health and promised a place in the Flock.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The chick is rushed back to camp, but grows weak and dies a few days later.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: p_l approaches the chick, only to realize that it's already gone. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/say/says} a small prayer and {VERB/p_l/bury/buries} it.

antagonize_text: p_l can't bear to leave the chick alone, so {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/take/takes} it to the border of the closest Flock and {VERB/p_l/wait/waits} for a patrol to arrive. The other Flock agrees to take the chick.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l attempts to take the chick to a neighboring Flock instead of leaving it, but it dies on the journey. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/give/gives} it a small burial.

intro_text: r_c finds a loner who offers their healing skills in exchange for shelter.
decline_text: Your patrol politely declines their offer.

success_text.unscathed_common: The new Carer is welcomed into the Flock.
success_text.unscathed_rare: The new Carer is welcomed into the Clan along with their clutch of chicks.

fail_text.unscathed_common: After hearing more about your Flock, the loner politely declines joining.

antagonize_text: The patrol says that they can't take on another right now, but they point the loner in the direction of the neighboring Flock.
antagonize_fail_text: The patrol says that they can't take on another right now and tries to direct the loner somewhere else, but the loner screeches and says that they can find their own way.

intro_text: p_l finds a loner who offers their healing skills in exchange for shelter.
decline_text: p_l politely declines their offer.

success_text.unscathed_common: The new Carer is welcomed into the Flock.
success_text.unscathed_rare: The new Carer is welcomed into the Flock along with their clutch of chicks.

fail_text.unscathed_common: After hearing more about your Flock, the loner politely declines joining.

antagonize_text: p_l says that c_n can't take on another right now, but {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/point/points} the loner in the direction of the neighboring Flock.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l says that c_n can't take on another right now and tries to direct the loner somewhere else, but the loner screeches and says that they can find their own way.

intro_text: Your patrol cautiously moves towards the sound of barking. Near the border, they spot a dog chasing something. Oh no, it's a birtac!
decline_text: The patrol decides not to interfere. Surely the birtac can fly away.

success_text.unscathed_common: The patrol swiftly jumps into action. They capture the dog's attention and draw it away from the birtac. r_c stays hidden and goes to the birtac while the rest of the patrol lures the dog away. They're unharmed, and this display of bravery makes them want to join the Flock!
success_text.stat_skill: s_c leaps into action, pelting towards the dog with a screech rising in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} throat. The dog looks alarmed by this newcomer and abandons the chase as s_c swipes at it. The loner, ruffled but unharmed, is amazed by this display. After some chatting, they decide to join the Flock.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The patrol swiftly jumps into action. They capture the dog's attention and draw it away from the birtac. r_c stayed hidden while the rest of the patrol lured the dog away, but when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/go/goes} to find the birtac, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} that it's still running! Oh well, at least they're alright.
fail_text.injury: The patrol jumps into action and chases the dog off without much difficulty. A group of birtacs is much different than a single one. However, the distressed loner seems to think that they're a threat and takes a swipe at r_c before running off.

antagonize_text: Your patrol watches as the loner climbs up a spindly tree to escape the dog, and then promptly proceed to chase the dog out of the territory. On their way back, they advise the loner that this is a dangerous area and maybe they shouldn't return.
antagonize_fail_text: The loner escapes the dog by climbing a tree and scowls at the patrol, who stood by watching. The patrol leaves, guilt pricking at them.

history_text.scar: r_c was scared when a loner attacked {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.
history_text.reg_death: r_c died after a loner attacked {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

antagonize_fail_text: A loner with their eggs emerges from the bush, but p_l shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head, and {VERB/p_l/tell/tells} the loner {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} meant it when {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} said {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} didn't want to see them again. The loner screeches and scratches at p_l. Rumors start at camp over what p_l said to the loner.
antagonize_text: A loner with their eggs emerges from the bush, but p_l shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head, and {VERB/p_l/inform/informs} them there's no room in c_n.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

fail_text.unscathed_common: p_l walks closer to the bush, intent on finding the source of the noise, only to come face to face with a skunk! The poor birtac ends up stinking for days after the unfortunate incident.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: s_c doesn't even hesitate before splitting from the patrol to check on the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} quickly {VERB/s_c/regret/regrets} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} impulsivity, however, when an angry raccoon bursts from the bush! s_c gets quite the scare, but thankfully the raccoon only wanted to get away from {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and quickly runs off back into the undergrowth.
fail_text.death: p_l takes the lead in checking the source of the noise and comes face to face with a rogue hiding in the bush! The rogue takes a swipe at p_l, but doesn't get much damage in before p_l retaliates and chases the intruder out c_n territory.

history_text.scar: p_l gained a scar after tussling with a loner.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear an odd sound coming from a nearby bush.

success_text.unscathed_common: Before p_l can move to check the bush, a loner emerges with their newly laid eggs. The birtac explains that they would like to join the Flock and after a short conversation with p_l, the loner and their eggs join the patrol on the journey back to camp.
success_text.unscathed_rare: p_l pads towards the bush to check on the noise when a rabbit suddenly bursts out, a loner following it! The loner speaks to p_l about Flock life, and how safe it would be for their newly laid eggs. p_l convinces the parent to join the Flock.
success_text.stat_trait: s_c takes the lead in checking the noise and finds that the bush is hiding a loner and their clutch! The chicks are freshly laid,  and s_c is quick to sit and talk quietly with the new parent. After some coaxing, s_c convinces them to come stay with the Flock for a while, maybe even to join permanently.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from a Wisp or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_text.unscathed_common: The sounds die away and then start up again in strange, unpredictable intervals. Investigating, p_l suddenly finds {PRONOUN/p_l/self} nose to nose with a panting, bleeding mother, one desperately trying to keep their newly laid clutch warm. p_l brings the mother back to camp, where the Flock can assist them.
success_text.unscathed_rare: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds a struggling mother curled around her eggs. r_c sprints back to camp to find help while p_l tries to make her eat some strengthening herbs. Thankful for the help the mother joins c_n, carrying her eggs.

fail_text.unscathed_common: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the bodies of an unknown parent with their eggs beside them, both slowly going cold. r_c goes back to camp to find help bringing their bodies back to camp to pay respects.

antagonize_text: p_l screeches at the Wisps for the sign, refusing to follow it to its source, and what might have been.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown parent and their eggs beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from a Wisp or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_text.unscathed_common: p_l, sure that it is a sign from a Wisp, follows the faint wailing. Instead {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/find/finds} a mother who lost their life in a harsh birth, their newly laid eggs surrounded by a body that will never move again. p_l instantly wraps {PRONOUN/p_l/self} around the eggs and orders r_c back to camp to find help and a Carer willing to nurse them.
success_text.unscathed_rare: It takes ages for p_l to pinpoint the sounds, but eventually {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/uncover/uncovers} the hidden birthing nest of a dead, cold mother, their newborn eggs by their side. p_l makes sure the mother is given a vigil - as the chicks grow older, they'll have questions about their parent.

fail_text.unscathed_common: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the body of an unknown parent with their eggs beside them, slowly going cold. r_c goes back to camp to find help bringing their bodies back to camp to pay respects.

antagonize_fail_text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown parent and their eggs beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

Investigating, p_l suddenly finds {PRONOUN/p_l/self} nose to nose with a panting, bleeding mother, one desperately trying to keep their newly laid eggs warm. p_l brings them back to camp, where the Flock can assist them.
success_text.unscathed_rare: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds a struggling mother curled around their newly laid eggs. p_l tries to make the mother eat some strengthening herbs, and slowly helps them back to camp. Thankful for the help, the mother joins c_n carrying her eggs.

fail_text.unscathed_common: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the body of an unknown parent with their eggs beside them, slowly going cold. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/cancel/cancels} {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol and {VERB/p_l/return/returns} to camp to get help sending these lost souls to the Wisps.

antagonize_fail_text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown parent and their eggs beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, they return home, their mind clouded.

decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from a Wisp or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

Instead {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/find/finds} a mother who lost their life in a harsh birth, their eggs laying next to a body that will never move again. p_l instantly wraps {PRONOUN/p_l/self} around the eggs and starts thinking about what they'll need to do to move them to camp.
success_text.unscathed_rare: It takes ages for p_l to pinpoint the sounds, but eventually {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/uncover/uncovers} the hidden birthing nest of a dead, cold mother, their newly laid eggs by their side. p_l makes sure the mother is given a vigil - as the chicks grow older, they'll have questions about their parent.

fail_text.unscathed_common: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the body of an unknown parent with their eggs beside them, slowly going cold. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/cancel/cancels} {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol and {VERB/p_l/return/returns} to camp to get help sending these lost souls to the Wisps.

antagonize_text: p_l screeches at the Wisps for the sign, refusing to follow it to its source, and what might it have been.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown parent and their eggs beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs, p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from a Wisp or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_text.unscathed_common: The sounds die away and then start up again in strange, unpredictable intervals. Investigating, p_l suddenly finds {PRONOUN/p_l/self} nose to nose with a panting, bleeding mother, one desperately trying to keep their new eggs warm. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/run/runs} for home, desperate to bring help.
success_text.unscathed_rare: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds a struggling mother with their newly laid eggs near them. Panicking, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/ask/asks} the mother to hold on just a little longer while {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/fetch/fetches} help, then {VERB/p_l/sprint/sprints} for home, cawing in case any patrol is nearby to assist.

fail_text.injury: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the body of an unknown parent with their chicks beside them, slowly going cold. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} desperately {VERB/p_l/try/tries} to save a newly hatched chick, but can't, and a Flockmate finds {PRONOUN/p_l/object} there sobbing hours later.

antagonize_text: p_l hisses at the Wisps for the sign, refusing to follow it to its source, and what might it have been.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown parent and their chicks beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs, p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from a Wisp or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_text.unscathed_common: p_l, sure that it is a sign from a Wisp, follows the faint wailing. Instead {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/find/finds} a mother who lost their life in a harsh birth, their newly hatched chicks clinging to a body that will never move again. p_l tries to comfort the poor kittens, curling around them to share {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} body heat, and wails until a passing patrol hears {PRONOUN/p_l/object}.
success_text.unscathed_rare: It takes ages for p_l to pinpoint the sounds, but eventually {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/uncover/uncovers} the hidden birthing nest of a dead, cold mother, their new eggs by their side. p_l vows to be the new eggs' family, to make sure they'll grow up loved and accepted.

fail_text.injury: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the body of an unknown parent with their chicks beside them, slowly going cold. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} desperately {VERB/p_l/try/tries} to save a chick, but can't, and a Flockmate finds {PRONOUN/p_l/object} there sobbing hours later.

antagonize_text: p_l screeches at the Wisps for the sign, refusing to follow it to its source, and what it might have been.
antagonize_fail_text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown parent and their chicks beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

intro_text: The patrol approaches a elkeir nest in the woods while hunting.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_text.unscathed_common: p_l hears r_c softly calling {PRONOUN/p_l/object} through the bushes, and drops the idea of following mouse scent, hurrying to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mate's side. r_c, head poking into the nest's garden through a gap in the fence, murmurs something about elkeir chicks. Elkeir chicks? No, r_c corrects, there's chicks wandering through the elkeir nest's garden, they need to be rescued before something happens to them!
success_text.unscathed_rare: Near the elkeir den, p_l suddenly hears furious chirps. Tiny, adorable, furious growls. A chick tries to pounce on p_l, barely coming up to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} ankles. Before little tusks can do any damage, p_l gently flips the tiny chick over and places a gentle tail on their back, completely pinning them as they struggle with all their might. r_c, called over by the mighty fight, asks the little one what on earth they're doing. Why, they're defending their home of course!
success_text.stat_trait: Furious, high pitched screeches greet the patrol, as a tiny chick comes running out of the elkeir nest to try and fight them. Terrifying. s_c tips the little fighter over and carefully scuffs the tiny chick - they can't leave them here. The chick insists that they're a big birtac and they're fine, but after a couple minutes, does reveal their mother is dead. They have kept alive somehow, but c_n will do better.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The patrol hears noises of movement. It could be an elkeir! They rush away, better safe than sorry.

antagonize_text: A chick approaches the patrol, screeching furiously. p_l bats it aside as the warriors continue hunting, unruffled.
antagonize_fail_text: The chicks trying furiously to defend their home ruin all the hunting to be had, and the patrol returns home, irritated but impressed by the chicks' bravery.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the area, they hear the traispe of footsteps through the territory.
decline_text: They decide to leave it alone. It's probably just another Flockmate out in the territory.

success_text.unscathed_common: The patrol approaches warily and comes upon a loner that's sniffing around. The loner notices their arrival and brightly says that they've heard about the Flock and wish to join. The patrol agrees to take them back to camp.
success_text.unscathed_rare: The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a loner that's sniffing around. The loner notices them and bundles towards the patrol, whose pelts bush out in surprise. The loner quickly begins a story about how they've been training for days now and they're finally ready to join c_n. Well alright then!
success_text.stat_skill: The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a loner that's sniffing around. The loner turns and bristles, puffing up at the patrol. s_c calls out a greeting to them and engages them in conversation, which seems to calm them down. They even agree when s_c asks if they'd like to join the Flock!

fail_text.unscathed_common: The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. They come upon a loner sniffing around. When the loner notices them, however, it turns tail and makes a hasty getaway. At least it's off the territory now.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. They come upon a loner sniffing around. They're about to approach calmly when s_c lets out a screech and rushes towards the loner, who quickly turns tail and runs.
fail_text.injury: The patrol follows the sound, ready to confront the intruder. They come upon a large loner that's sniffing around. They begin to approach, but the loner immediately turns on them. r_c doesn't have enough time to move as the loner launches a quick attack. p_l bats the loner away and helps r_c back to camp.

antagonize_text: The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. A loner, not paying any mind to the noise they are making, carrying a stash of objects. They scare them off easily.
antagonize_fail_text: The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a loner that's sniffing around. The loner quickly begins a story about how they've been training for days now and they're finally ready to join c_n. p_l laughs and gets swatted by the angry loner. Embarrassed, the patrol goes home.

history_text.scar: This cat gained a scar from a fight with an angry loner.

intro_text: The patrol is checking along the border lines when they hear a startling sound - a growl of pain? They quickly follow the sound to the source. It's a loner, and they appear to be injured.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_text.unscathed_common: The patrol approaches cautiously. The loner draws themself up, but doing so causes them to let out another growl. p_l offers to bring them to camp. Though they seem hesitant, the loner agrees.
success_text.unscathed_rare: The patrol approaches cautiously. The loner lifts their head and asks for help. p_l agrees. They can't leave a fellow birtac to die.
success_text.stat_skill: The loner growls defensively as the patrol comes closer. s_c speaks soothingly to the loner, assuring them that they mean no harm and simply want to help. The loner seems distrustful, but allows p_l to help them back to camp.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The patrol warily approaches the loner, who doesn't seem to notice them. It's obvious that the birtac is bleeding out. p_l attempts to staunch the bleeding and carry the birtac to camp, but it's no use. Hopefully the loner didn't suffer too much.

antagonize_text: The patrol launches into attack, only to find the loner that they've been fighting is too weak to fight back. They go home with blood on their talons.
antagonize_fail_text: The patrol approaches the loner cautiously, intending to attack. Instead, they find a Wisp, who scolds them all for being willing to attack a hurt loner. With shame in their hearts, the patrol goes back home, and tells no one of what they saw.

intro_text: app1 is by {PRONOUN/app1/self} when {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/hear/hears} a birtac screeching for help.
decline_text: Nope, not today, there's no way app1 is running after ghost birtacs, no thank you.

success_text.unscathed_common: Oh Wisps, app1 can't live with leaving some poor sad soul alone on the mountainside! Following the pitious cries, app1 finds a terrified loner crouched by a Thunderpath, desperately searching for the scent of those it knows. But it's alright, app1 is here, and c_n will be able to help.
success_text.unscathed_rare: Wisps, but the loner {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/find/finds} is weird, their feathers soft and thin, their cries desperate as they call in confusion. app1 comes down to them, startling the poor thing half out of their pelt. The loner calms down as app1 offers to bring them back to camp, where {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} sure the day will seem less bleak once app1 can get them food and a warm nest.
success_text.stat_trait: app1 follows the sad cries to find a loner, lost and alone and cold. The apprentice introduces {PRONOUN/app1/self} cheerfully, and the desperate loner nearly tumbles them over in their haste to press their nose to app1's shoulder, breaking into desperately grateful purrs.

fail_text.unscathed_common: The birtac seems to be moving all over the place, and finally, app1 gives up and goes home, too tired to catch more than a mouthful.
fail_text.unscathed_stat: s_c calls out to the birtac, only to be met with raucous cawing. {VERB/s_c/Are/Is} {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} being laughed at? {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/decide/decides} to slink off, leaving it be.

antagonize_text: app1 screams that this is c_n's territory and there's no help for anyone else. A birtac runs from {PRONOUN/app1/object}, terrified of the echoing voice.
antagonize_fail_text: app1 charges after the sound to attack the birtac, only for the birtac to bowl {PRONOUN/app1/object} over as they run, in their haste to get away.
